conclusion: To determine how shadows A, B, and C will change when the light source moves to the right above the objects, we need to analyze the current positions of these shadows and then predict their new positions based on the shift in the light source's location.
Shadow A is cast by the birdcage and appears to be centered below the cage.
Shadow B is cast by the small object (possibly a shoe or a similar item) and is located towards the right side of the image.
Shadow C is cast by the chicken leg and is positioned below the leg itself.

When the light source moves to the right, its relative position to the objects will change, and shadows will move in the opposite direction relative to the objects they are cast from because shadows form perpendicular to the direction of the light.
Shadow A will move to the right of its current position because the birdcage will cast its shadow further to the right due to the movement of the light source.
Shadow B will move to the right of its current position because the small object will cast its shadow further to the right due to the movement of the light source.
Shadow C will move to the right of its current position because the chicken leg will cast its shadow further to the right due to the movement of the light source.
All three shadows (A, B, and C) will move to the right when the light source moves to the right above the objects.
